alert.note: Alert for Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 10:02AM MDT until April 23 at 4:48AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota... Turtle Creek At Redfield affecting Spink County. .For sites with a river forecast, the forecast includes precipitation through the next 24 hours. Any future precipitation could affect the forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Turtle Creek At Redfield. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Moderate flooding of agricultural land outside of Redfield begins on the right side of Turtle Creek * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CDT Friday was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 4.5 feet Friday morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Saturday evening by 715 PM CDT.
